channel.title: Item ID Check Variable
channel.description: I am using Project Insanity base source and I am making it so you have to be 99 attack to wear an attack cape, I dunno how to check for the item id, I have tried [code]if (ItemID == 9747)[/code] and [code]if (useItemID == 9747)[/code] but they don't work.

item.title: Item ID Check Variable
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Package: src/server/model/items
Class: ItemAssistant
Method: getRequirements(String itemName, int itemId)
Statement: switch(itemId)

Add this case in the switch statement.

case ATTACK_SKILL_CAPE_ID: c.attackLevelReq = 99; break; [/quote]

Hehehehe… Sorry… I’ll stop now

Read full topic

item.title: Item ID Check Variable
item.dc:creator: @Blood_Realm Blood Realm
item.description:
@Blood_Realm wrote:

I have case 9747: // Attack cape c.attackLevelReq = 99; return; in the switch statement buh now I have to make it so if the item tries to be worn that it checks the players level, so in public boolean wearItem(int wearID, int slot) { I have if(targetSlot == 0) { if(c.attackLevelReq > 0) { if(c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[0]) < c.attackLevelReq) { c.sendMessage("You need an attack level of "+c.attackLevelReq+" to wear this item."); canWearItem = false; } } } cause targetSlot == 0 means the cape slot, so if I add all the skill capes to the switch part it’s gunna say you need 99 attack for all capes

so I wanted to do if(targetSlot == 0 && ItemID == 9747) { buh there’s no such variable as ItemID

Read full topic
